revised_title: Investigating the Effects of Peripheral Resistance and Circulation Capacity on the Heart-Lung Preparation
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on a closed-circuit heart-lung preparation to study the effects of alterations in peripheral resistance and circulation capacity. They found that reducing circulation capacity or injecting blood into the system increased all pressures and cardiac output, while increasing capacity or withdrawing blood had the opposite effect. The authors also discovered that the "potential capacity increment" of the arterial system plays a significant role in regulating blood pressure and cardiac output.
